#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Tell the Edition of a Book
#Text=Whether you ’re a book collector searching for a first edition or you ’re a student looking for the most recent copy of a textbook , finding out which edition of a book you have is crucial .
#Text=While most publishers will lay out the information for you , it may still be tricky to find .
#Text=By examining your book carefully , you ’ll be able to tell which edition of a book you possess .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Checking the Copyright Page
#Text=Look for text that states the edition of the book .
#Text=Sometimes , the publisher will clearly write which edition of the book you have on the bottom of the copyright page .
#Text=Look for the phrase “ First Edition ” followed by the year .
#Text=If you ’re lucky , the copyright page will list the years each edition was released .
#Text=If the publisher of the book has changed since it was first released , the edition number is reset .
#Text=This means there could technically be two or more first editions of the same book .
#Text=A “ true ” first edition of a book is the first time the text was published in the first printing run of the book .
#Text=Check the year the book was copyrighted versus when it was published .
#Text=Find the phrase “ Text copyright ” at the top of the page .
#Text=If the copyright year and the year of publication is the same , it is likely that you have a first edition of the book .
#Text=If they are different , you will know you have a later edition of the book .
#Text=The dates may differ on a first edition if the copyright was acquired at a different time than the publishing .
#Text=If edits have been made to the text of the book , there may be multiple years listed under the copyright date .
#Text=Always use the most recent year as your basis of judgement .
#Text=Use the number line to determine the printing .
#Text=The number line near the bottom of the page does n’t necessarily determine the edition , but it tells you how many times the book has been printed .
#Text=If there is a 1 still present in the number line , it is the first print of the book from the publisher .
#Text=As more runs are printed , the lowest number in the line will determine what printing you have .
#Text=The numbers may be in numerical order or they may be in no discernible order .
#Text=Always look for the lowest number .
#Text=Sometimes , the printing year is also included in the line , denoted by the last 2 digits of the year .
#Text=For example , the number line may read 1 2 3 4 5 00 99 98 97 96 .
#Text=This book would then be the 1st print in 1996 .
#Text=Examining Other Parts of the Book
#Text=Research the differences between editions of the book .
#Text=Usually , the edition will only change if the content inside of the book has changed .
#Text=If there ’s a line added or removed from the dust jacket or a new passage is put in , it could signal the book is an updated edition .
#Text=Many websites will list what the differences are between the editions .
#Text=For non-fiction books , new information or studies may be added in newer editions to keep the information current and clear .
#Text=Check the dust jacket to see if your book is a “ Book Club Edition . ”
#Text=Book club editions are books produced specifically for book-of-the-month clubs or similar services .
#Text=Inside the dust jacket , instead of a price , it will either read ‘ ’ Book Club Edition ’ ’ or have a 5-digit code for identification .
#Text=Book club editions may leave the area that normally has a barcode blank as well .
#Text=Determine if the ISBN is for a limited edition .
#Text=The International Standard Book Number , or ISBN , is a unique 10 or 13 digit number to notate an edition or variation of a book .
#Text=While a limited edition copy of a book is usually noted on the cover or copyright page , you can check the ISBN listed above the barcode .
#Text=Search the ISBN online or compare it to the ones listed on the copyright page .
#Text=The same book can have multiple ISBNs depending on if it ’s released in hardcover , paperback , or a limited edition style .
#Text=Example Copyright Page
#Text=Doc : Copyright Page
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Changes in cover design does not necessarily warrant a change of edition if a publisher has not changed , but it will indicate a difference in print runs .
